department: College of Computing and Digital Media
biography: Dennis Mumaugh joined the CDM part-time faculty in the fall of 2000.  He has taught IS 375, CSC 310, 343, 373, 416, 447, and 548, and SE 425, 430, 435, 468, 477, 550 and 552.  Dennis is retired from Bell Laboratories/Lucent Technologies where he was most recently a Member of the Technical Staff in the Optical Networking Group involved with Software Tools. Previously he was a senior engineer in UNIX support and development. He also has worked for the National Security Agency as a Senior Electronic Engineer where he was involved with the original internet and a UNIX pioneer.  Dennis earned an MS in computer science from the University of Maryland at College Park and a BSEE in communications and computers from the University of California, Berkeley.
